docs.lead_paragraph: PICTURE to yourself a line of ailing poor waiting in one of New York's dispensaries for treatment. The physicians are all volunteers, chiefly young men, anxious alike to be of service to humanity and gain experience. They draw no salaries whatever.

headline.main: MOST OF NEW YORK'S ILLNESS IS PREVENTABLE; Teaching People to Keep Well, the Thing, Says Dr. C. Irving Fisher of the Presbyterian Hospital -- A New Fight Against the Common Cold.

docs.snippet: PICTURE to yourself a line of ailing poor waiting in one of New York's dispensaries for treatment. The physicians are all volunteers, chiefly young men, anxious alike to be of service to humanity and gain experience. They draw no salaries whatever.
